Categories: Question Answering -> Multiple Choice Question Answering
Definition:
Given a premise and two alternatives, choose the alternative that is a more plausible cause or effect of the situation described by the premise. The input format is "premise
(1)alternative_1(2)alternative_2", the output should either be "1" or "2" based on your judgment.

Positive Examples.input:
The women met for coffee.
(1)The cafe reopened in a new location.(2)They wanted to catch up with each other.
Positive Examples.explanation: The second alternative makes more sense because meeting for coffee could be because of wanting to catch up with each other.

Positive Examples.input:
My body cast a shadow over the grass.
(1)The sun was rising.(2)The grass was cut.
Positive Examples.explanation: The first alternative makes more sense because casting a shadow is the effect of the sun being in the sky.

Positive Examples.input:
The guests of the party hid behind the couch.
(1)It was a surprise party.(2)It was a birthday party.
Positive Examples.explanation: The first alternative makes more sense because the guest hiding behind the couch could be because the party being a surprise.

Negative Examples.input:
My body cast a shadow over the grass.
(1)The sun was rising.(2)The grass was cut.
Negative Examples.explanation: casting a shadow has nothing to do with the grass being cut.
